intro: Aerides odorata var. major, commonly known as the giant orchid, is a species of orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that can reach up to 10 cm in diameter. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in tropical rainforests. Its leaves are broad and革质, providing structural support and efficient water retention. This variety is prized for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in greenhouses or as a houseplant.
